question: 1. (001) Light fixtures are classified by

correct: a. the way they distribute light.

correct: a. Box is sized to support the fixture.

question: 15. (005) What are the two types of phase cut dimmers?
options: d. Single pole and double pole.

question: 16. (005) How does a phase cut dimmer operate?
options: a. A variable resistor is used to lower the voltage.
b. Two or more resistors are used to form a voltage divider.
c. The root mean square (RMS) voltage is reduced by turning off a portion of the input waveform.
d. Semiconductor switches are used to turn off only the negative portion of the input waveform.
correct: c. The root mean square (RMS) voltage is reduced by turning off a portion of the input waveform.

correct: d. adjusting fixtures so that illuminated areas overlap.

correct: a. Fixtures are designed so that no cords are exposed.

question: 58. (017) What is used to maintain contact with the tower when away from the truck?

correct: d. Twist the entire fixture counterclockwise several full rotations.

question: 60. (018) Which approach lighting system maintenance item must be performed daily?

correct: c. Check and record burned out lamps.

question: 61. (018) When should you check all approach light fixtures for alignment?

correct: c. On the left side of the runway.

question: 63. (019) What occurs when a precision approach path indicator (PAPI) unit gets misaligned by more than ยฝ degree up or 1 degree down?
options: a. A buzzer sounds in the tower cab.
b. A tilt switch opens the entire circuit.
c. A warning light is turned on at the unit.
d. A warning light is turned on at the vault.
correct: b. A tilt switch opens the entire circuit.

question: 64. (020) How often are dielectric oil tests made on airfield regulators?

correct: c. Move the control wire from step 5 relay to step 4 relay.

correct: d. Support both leads and keep them clear of each other and the ground.

d. apply semi-conducting tape to the conductor for the length of the elbow.
correct: c. align the hole on the end of the connector with the equipment bushing.

question: 59. (424) After sliding the elbow over the connector and cable the next step is to
options: a. attach the threaded electrode to the connector using a pair of adjustable pliers.
b. thread the electrode into the connector using the wrench from the elbow kit.
c. thread the electrode into the connector until it is hand tight.
d. crimp the electrode onto the connector.
correct: b. thread the electrode into the connector using the wrench from the elbow kit.

question: 60. (425) What depth do you dig the trench for a below-ground check of a pole?
61. (425) Decay usually starts at what location on a crossarm?
62. (425) What condition can cause a crossarm to twist?
options: c. Unbalanced strain or insufficient guying.
d. Crossarm unseasoned when it was installed.
correct: c. Unbalanced strain or insufficient guying.

question: 63. (426) When a span shows too much sag while adjacent spans appear normal,
options: a. the conductor has stretched from being hit by a falling object.
b. the cause is a twisted crossarm.
c. it's a sign of loose tie wires.
d. it's a result of poor guying.
correct: a. the conductor has stretched from being hit by a falling object.

question: 64. (426) We must make voltage and current readings on capacitor installations at least
65. (427) What do we use to cut tree limbs that are beyond arm's reach?

b. Lay it flat on the ground.
c. Lean it against a tree limb.
d. Lay it across the truck bed.
correct: c. Lean it against a tree limb.

question: 67. (427) What species of trees do we usually top?
68. (428) What is usually the first step in troubleshooting a tripped overhead distribution circuit?
options: d. Try to reset the circuit's recloser.

question: 69. (428) What do we use to test a distribution line for a ground?
70. (428) Which of these is not one of the three main causes of power line noise?
options: b. Bonded ground wires on the utility pole.
c. Electrostatic leakage from ungrounded hardware.
d. Loose connections in the primary or neutral circuit.
correct: b. Bonded ground wires on the utility pole.

question: 71. (429) What must the electrician do before working on deenergized lines?
options: b. Test and ground the lines.
c. Close the normally open switch.
correct: b. Test and ground the lines.

question: 72. (429) How is the cable used for ground sets constructed?
options: a. 600-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered flexible copper.
b. 5,000-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered flexible copper.
c. 600-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered hard-drawn copper.
d. 5,000-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered hard-drawn copper.
correct: a. 600-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered flexible copper.

question: 73. (430) When a break occurs in an energized line, how is the line at the break affected?
options: a. Both ends of the wire are melted.
b. Both ends of the wire are hardened.
c. The whole wire get very brittle and charred.
d. The center disappears, leaving soft wire on either side.
correct: d. The center disappears, leaving soft wire on either side.

question: 74. (430) What do you use to check a suspected damaged transformer?
75. (431) What must you do before working on energized lines?
options: a. Inspect the utility pole for heart-rot.
b. Fill out AF Form 980, Caution Abnormal Conditions tag.
c. Inspect hot line tools and equipment for proper operation.
d. Fill out AF Form 103, Base Civil Engineering Work Clearance Request.
correct: c. Inspect hot line tools and equipment for proper operation.

question: 76. (431) What two connector types do we use when splicing energized conductors?
options: c. Hot line clamp and split-bolt.
d. Compression and hot line clamp.

question: 77. (431) In making a midspan splice on an energized line, position the personnel bucket of the bucket truck
options: a. at a 45ยฐ angle to the break.
b. parallel to the area to be spliced.
c. directly under the area to be spliced.
d. so the linemen can face the splice area from the front of the bucket.
correct: d. so the linemen can face the splice area from the front of the bucket.

question: 78. (432) What tie stick head do we normally use to untie tie wires?

question: 84. (434) After you remove the crossarm, who lowers it to the ground?
85. (435) Service meters are used to determine
options: a. if sufficient voltage is reaching a facility or organization.
b. how large a service is needed for a facility or organization.
c. if sufficient amperage is reaching a facility or organization.
d. how much power has been used by a facility or organization.
correct: d. how much power has been used by a facility or organization.

question: 86. (435) The service meter normally measures
87. (435) What is the formula to find the amount of watt-hours used?
options: c. Multiplier times the previous reading.
d. New reading minus the previous reading.
correct: d. New reading minus the previous reading.

question: 88. (435) When transposing the numbers from the dial meter to a piece of paper, start on the.
options: a. right hand dial then work to the left.
b. left hand dial then work to the right.
c. top dial then work to the bottom.
d. bottom dial then work to the top.
correct: a. right hand dial then work to the left.

question: 89. (436) What is the approximate bending radius for underground cable?
90. (436) How much straight cable needs to exist on each side of a cable splice for racking purposes?

93. (436) Generally if a cable's insulation is deteriorating, what does a direct current high potential(DC Hypot) cable test indicate for each succeeding test?
options: a. Lower resistance or a lower power factor.
b. Lower resistance or a higher power factor.
c. Higher resistance or a lower power factor.
d. Higher resistance or a higher power factor.
correct: b. Lower resistance or a higher power factor.

question: 94. (437) What is the easiest and quickest way to locate a cable fault?
95. (437) When you check for a grounded conductor with a volt-ohmmeter, what reading would indicate a grounded conductor?
96. (437) When you use the mm-1 fault locator or the thumper to locate a cable fault, when you are over the fault location
options: a. the signal increases with both testers.
b. the signal decreases with both testers.
c. fault locator signal increases at the fault; thumper signal decreases.
d. fault locator signal fades out at the fault; thumper signal increases to the loudest volume.
correct: d. fault locator signal fades out at the fault; thumper signal increases to the loudest volume.

question: 97. (438) In many cases, a cable fault is located at a
98. (438) Which cable splice kit requires the most labor to install?
99. (439) What should be your first step when troubleshooting a pad mount transformer?
options: a. Take a complete set of secondary phase-to-phase and phase-to-ground voltage readings.
b. Take a complete set of primary phase-to-phase and phase-to-ground voltage readings.
c. Take phase-to-phase voltage readings on the secondary side of the transformer.
d. Take phase-to-ground voltage readings on the primary side.
correct: a. Take a complete set of secondary phase-to-phase and phase-to-ground voltage readings.

question: 100. (439) If tests indicate an off-ratio winding, how would you verify whether or not the problem was in the transformer?
options: a. Take primary current readings on all three phases.
b. Take secondary current readings on all three phases.
c. Take voltage readings on the primary side of the transformer.
d. De-energize the transformer and take resistance readings on the transformer windings.
correct: c. Take voltage readings on the primary side of the transformer.

question: 1. (601) What is the next step in installing strobe lights after you ground the series circuit adapter and master strobe?
options: a. Set the on-off switches to the on position.
b. Set the strobe master switch to remote.

question: 2. (601) What is the TAG's first step in installing the strobe units?
options: a. Position the strobe master unit so that its window faces away from the runway.
b. Position the strobe master unit so that its window faces toward the runway.
c. Position the series circuit adapter (SCA) next to the strobe slave.
d. Connect the strobe unit to the SCA.
correct: a. Position the strobe master unit so that its window faces away from the runway.

question: 3. (601) What is the next step after the TAG installs the 1000 foot crossbar?
options: a. Go back to the outboard strobe location and install it.
b. Go directly to the threshold and position the lights.
c. Position the inboard strobe slave unit.

question: 4. (601) What is the final step in installing the runway edge lights?
options: a. Connect the fixture to an isolation transformer.
b. Connect the fixture to the rest of the airfield circuit.
c. Install an isolation transformer inboard of the fixture.
d. Anchor each light fixture with two ballast rings or one stake.
correct: d. Anchor each light fixture with two ballast rings or one stake.

question: 5. (601) What do you do first when leveling and aiming a precision approach path indicator (PAPI)unit?
options: a. Level the unit from side to side by adjusting the unit's two front knobs.
b. Level the unit from front to back by adjusting the unit's rear knob.
c. Adjust the aim of the unit to provide a 3-degree glide slope.
d. Adjust the PAPI unit's tilt switch.
correct: a. Level the unit from side to side by adjusting the unit's two front knobs.

question: 6. (601) What is the final step in installation of the precision approach path indicator (PAPI) units?
options: a. Install a photocell on either unit.
b. Stake each unit securely to the ground.
c. Align each unit so that it is parallel with the runway.
d. Adjust the tilt switch so that the bubble is in the middle.
correct: d. Adjust the tilt switch so that the bubble is in the middle.

question: 7. (601) How do you begin the procedure for installing the emergency airfield lighting system obstruction lights?
options: a. Install the batteries into the fixture.
b. Connect the fixture straight into the runway circuit.
c. Connect the fixture to the runway circuit through a transformer.
d. Connect the fixture to the runway circuit through a series circuit adapter (SCA).
correct: a. Install the batteries into the fixture.

question: 8. (602) When performing an open circuit test on the regulator, what is the next step after turning the circuit breaker off?
options: a. Turn the intensity selector switch to the OFF position.
b. Turn the intensity selector switch to the LOW intensity setting.
c. Install the male-to-male adapter cable into the output current plugs.
d. Remove the male-to-male adapter cable from the output current plugs.
correct: d. Remove the male-to-male adapter cable from the output current plugs.

question: 9. (603) When replacing a lamp on a runway edge light, how do you remove the lamp from its base?
options: a. Grip the lamp by its ceramic base and pull straight up.
b. Turn the lamp in a counter-clockwise direction.
c. Loosen the screws holding the lamp in place.
d. Turn the lamp in a clock-wise direction.
correct: a. Grip the lamp by its ceramic base and pull straight up.

question: 10. (603) How do you remove the red lens from an obstruction light?
options: a. Unscrew the lens in a clock-wise direction.
b. Unscrew the lens in a counter-clockwise direction.
c. Remove the screws holding the lens in place and pull the lens straight up.
d. Loosen the screws holding the lens in place, turn it to the right, and pull it straight up.
correct: d. Loosen the screws holding the lens in place, turn it to the right, and pull it straight up.

question: 11. (603) Which of the following is a step in the process of changing out a lamp in a strobe unit?
options: a. Disconnect the fixture from the series circuit adapter.
b. Disconnect the fixture from the airfield circuit.
c. Connect the fixture's case to ground.

question: 12. (603) What is the procedure for removing the electrical connection from a precision approach path indicator (PAPI) lamp?
options: a. Loosen the terminal screw and remove the connection from the lamp.
b. Push in the connector and turn it counterclockwise.
c. Pull the connection straight back off the lamp.
d. Push in the connector and turn it clockwise.
correct: b. Push in the connector and turn it counterclockwise.

question: 13. (604) What generator is used for emergency backup of facilities that are mission essential, such as communications centers and command posts?
14. (605) Besides conductor size, what is another important factor to consider when reducing voltage drop in an electrical circuit?

16. (606) How do you start the engine of a mission essential power (MEP) 806B generator?
options: a. Turn on ENGINE CONTROL switch.
b. Close the ENGINE CONTROL switch.
c. Close the ENGINE CONTROL circuit breaker.
d. Hold ENGINE CONTROL switch in the START for 2 seconds.
correct: d. Hold ENGINE CONTROL switch in the START for 2 seconds.

question: 17. (606) What is the first step to shutting down a generator?
options: b. Place ENGINE CONTROL switch in the OFF position.
c. Select SHUTDOWN COMPUTER on CIM display screen.
d. Hold alternating current (AC) CIRCUIT INTERRUPT switch in OPEN position to open the load contactor.
correct: d. Hold alternating current (AC) CIRCUIT INTERRUPT switch in OPEN position to open the load contactor.

question: 18. (607) When operating in extremely cold climates, what must you do to prevent the battery from freezing when you add water?
options: a. Reposition the battery closer to the engine.
b. Use a weak salt solution to fill the battery.
c. Immediately mix the fluid by charging the battery.
d. Do not add fluid when below freezing temperatures are expected.
correct: c. Immediately mix the fluid by charging the battery.

question: 19. (608) The Basic Expeditionary Airfield Resources Order of Battle (BOB) is based on increments on of how many personnel?
20. (608) On a 25-kw power distribution panel (PDP), what is the 60-amp output utilized for?

d. To connect a field deployable environmental control unit (FDECU).
correct: d. To connect a field deployable environmental control unit (FDECU).

29. (611) What is used to ground the reverse osmosis water purification unit (ROWPU)?

b. A three-piece ground rod that is stored on the control panel.
c. A ยพ inch ground rod that is 10 feet in length.

correct: b. A three-piece ground rod that is stored on the control panel.

question: 30. (611) What safety precaution should be taken prior to disconnecting any pipes or equipment on the reverse osmosis water purification unit (ROWPU)?
options: b. Open all drains and vents.
c. Turn off chemical feed pumps.
d. Prime the reverse osmosis pump.
correct: b. Open all drains and vents.

question: 31. (611) Where is the reverse osmosis water purification unit (ROWPU) ground rod stored?

correct: d. Basic expeditionary airfield resources (BEAR) kitchen.

b. close the mission essential power breaker.
c. contact the disaster control center.
d. ensure all power is removed.
correct: d. ensure all power is removed.

question: 45. (614) What is the mostly likely problem when there is no power to any of the outbound primary distribution center feeders?

51. (615) How do you de-energize the transformer windings of one secondary distribution center(SDC) without de-energizing any of the interconnected SDCs?
options: a. Turn off the main circuit breaker.
b. Pull the three fused disconnects in the high-voltage compartment.
c. De-energize the main feeder at the primary switching center (PSC).
d. Disconnect the load-break elbows in the high-voltage compartment.
correct: b. Pull the three fused disconnects in the high-voltage compartment.

question: 52. (616) What can you do to ground the system if the ground rod cannot be driven into the earth during deployments to locations where low voltage will be used for a short time?
options: a. Connect generator ground to system neutral.
b. Bury the ground rod in a horizontal trench that is 18 inches deep.
c. No grounds are required for low-voltage short-time deployments.
d. Drive the ground rod in as far as it will go, and cut off the excess.
correct: b. Bury the ground rod in a horizontal trench that is 18 inches deep.

question: 53. (616) What mixture of salt and water normally increases the conductivity of the soil that is in contact with a ground rod?
options: a. 1 pound of salt per 1 gallon of water.
b. 1 pound salt per 3 gallons of water.
c. 3 pounds of salt per 1 gallon of water.
d. 3 pounds of salt per 5 gallons of water.
correct: c. 3 pounds of salt per 1 gallon of water.

question: 54. (617) How many light streamers are installed in each tent?

options: a. In the proper storage containers.
b. In an approved cargo container.
c. In the middle of the tent.
correct: a. In the proper storage containers.
